messages.text:
A friend passed me this yesterday, said it made a huge difference in his success rates. He's got a fair bit of depth as a startup advisor and entrepreneur so it seemed worth digging through 

<https://medium.com/crane-taking-flight/fundraising-why-you-shouldnt-just-copy-sequoia-s-pitch-deck-template-4b32ac60d93a|https://medium.com/crane-taking-flight/fundraising-why-you-shouldnt-just-copy-sequoia-s-pitch-deck-template-4b32ac60d93a>

attachments.fallback: Bloomberg.com: Humanity Protocol Becomes Crypto’s New Digital Identity Unicorn
attachments.text: The startup raised $30 million at a $1 billion valuation as it looks to challenge projects like Worldcoin.
attachments.title: Humanity Protocol Becomes Crypto’s New Digital Identity Unicorn

messages.text: News like this makes me shake my head sometime: A seed round of $30M valuing the company at $1B? This is like having a Blockchain enabled digital vault for one's identity: <https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2024-05-15/humanity-protocol-becomes-crypto-s-new-digital-identity-unicorn?embedded-checkout=true>
One billion? Wow
That's an important problem to solve
Still, it runs up against the same norms problem a lot of blockchain does: the blockchain can say whatever it wants, there needs to be a mechanism to make the real world conform
It’s an important problem at the core of a lot of verticals - fin tech, healthcare and citizenship. UPI in India shows why it’s big. Still this early $1b valuation is nuts

Identity management, yeah for sure. I think this one feels pressing to me because the potential for mischief is so extreme and immediate (viral videos of me saying shit I would never say).

Hari and I talked about building exactly this, like a year or two ago. Ensuring that videos use this as a standard for validation is one challenge; monetizing it might even be a bigger one.

So yeah, i think there's easily a billion dollars of impact. But it's tough to argue for an actual valuation lol.

attachments.title: App analytics firm Sensor Tower acquires rival Data.ai and is cutting staff | TechCrunch

messages.text:
jospehine and my previous company: <http://data.ai|data.ai> gets acquired by a much smaller competitor and immediately lays off 60% of the team. :pensive:

<https://techcrunch.com/2024/03/18/app-analytics-firm-sensor-tower-acquires-rival-data-ai/|https://techcrunch.com/2024/03/18/app-analytics-firm-sensor-tower-acquires-rival-data-ai/>

PE firm makes $$ from Day 1, using a consolidation play that <http://data.ai|data.ai>’s own CEO and investors (Sequoia etc) didn’t care to pursue when the downturn happened. What a sad day to a great brand and once high flying company
ugh sorry to hear. vulture capital ftw
good job not being there lol
Yes! Glad I didn’t have to get swept up by those layoffs. Got a lawyer and fought for a decent severance for myself
The CEO is an utterly incompetent and a full on egotistical ass. Surrounded himself with not very good people either.  Most of the exec team left within a month of each other.

That’s true, anyone with an ounce of integrity and agency could only put up with the CEO and all his “first team”, “we don’t want to get sued again” talk only for so long before they decamped. 

He managed the company through the SEC investigation but emerged a scared cat and managed to run the company into the ground in less than 2 years

Not to rehash old stuff - he and he only needed to sell or at least try to make up for revenue churn, which he thought was beneath him after decades being a sales guy! Go figure! Plus he was petrified of the board - which is what rookies do
This is at <http://data.ai|data.ai>? I definitely sensed some cultural issues there when I started the interview process but got stood up at 5am for politics :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
